00003 static const double Epsilon = 0.000001;

00005 GrahamsScan::GrahamsScan()
00006 {
00007   firstPoint = NULL;
00008 }

00010 GrahamsScan::~GrahamsScan()
00011 {
00012   deleteAllPoints();

00014 
00015 std::vector< vector2f, std::allocator< vector2f > > GrahamsScan::run(vector< vector2f > points)
00016 {
00017   static const bool debug = false;
00018   vector<vector2f> convexPolygon;
00019   convexPolygon.clear();
00020   int minPoint=0;
00021   point *tempPtr;
00022   NumPoints = int(points.size());
00023   firstPoint=NULL; //INIT FIRSTPOINT POINTER
00024   
00025   if(NumPoints<4)
00026     return points;
00027   
00028   if(debug) printf("\nGraham scan:\n");
00029   for (int k=1;k<NumPoints;k++){  //FIND MIN POINT
00030     if(debug)
00031       printf("%d. %7.4f , %7.4f\n",k,V2COMP(points[k]));
00032     if( (points[k].y==points[minPoint].y && points[k].x<points[minPoint].x) ||
00033       (points[k].y<points[minPoint].y) )
00034       minPoint=k;
00035   }
00036   
00037   if(debug) printf("%d points, minPoint:%d\n",NumPoints, minPoint);
00038   /*
00039   if(printDebugStream)
00040     debugStream<<NumPoints<<" points, minPoint:"<<minPoint<<"\n";
00041   */
00042   
00043   GrahamsScan::point p;
00044   for (int i=0;i<NumPoints;i++){ //SORT RANDOM POINTS
00045     p.loc = points[i];
00046     p.angle = findAngle(points[minPoint],points[i]);
00047     addPoint(p);
00048   }
00049   
00050   tempPtr=firstPoint;
00051   do{ //FIND LAST NODE IN LINKED LIST
00052     tempPtr=tempPtr->next;
00053   } while (tempPtr->next!=NULL);
00054   
00055   tempPtr->next=firstPoint; //COMPLETE CIRCULAR LINKED LIST
00056   firstPoint->prev=tempPtr; //COMPLETE CIRCULAR LINKED LIST
00057   if(debug){
00058     tempPtr=firstPoint;
00059     int k=0;
00060     printf("Sorted list:\n");
00061     do{ //FIND LAST NODE IN LINKED LIST
00062       printf("%d. %7.4f , %7.4f (%7.4f , %7.4f @ %.7f\u00b0)\n",k,V2COMP(tempPtr->loc),V2COMP(tempPtr->loc-firstPoint->loc), DEG((tempPtr->loc-firstPoint->loc).angle()));
00063       tempPtr=tempPtr->next;
00064       k++;
00065     } while (tempPtr!=firstPoint);
00066     printf("Checking Convexity:\n");
00067   }
00068   grahamScan(firstPoint);
00069   
00070   tempPtr=firstPoint;
00071   for (int i=0;i<NumPoints;i++) 
00072   {
00073     convexPolygon.push_back(tempPtr->loc);
00074     tempPtr=tempPtr->next;
00075     if(tempPtr==firstPoint)
00076       break;
00077   }
00078   deleteAllPoints();
00079   return convexPolygon;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void GrahamsScan::grahamScan(GrahamsScan::point* P)
00083 {
00084   static const bool debug = false;
00085   point *tempPrev, *tempNext;
00086   P=P->next;
00087   do{
00088     while(P!=firstPoint && !isConvexPoint(P)){
00089       if(P->prev==firstPoint){
00090         tempPrev=P->prev; 
00091         tempNext=P->next;
00092         tempPrev->next=tempNext;
00093         tempNext->prev=tempPrev;
00094         if(debug) printf("deleting colinear point %f,%f\n",V2COMP(P->loc));
00095         delete P; //FREE MEMORY
00096         P = tempNext;
00097       }else{
00098         tempPrev=P->prev; 
00099         tempNext=P->next;
00100         tempPrev->next=tempNext;
00101         tempNext->prev=tempPrev;
00102         if(debug) printf("deleting non-convex point %f,%f\n",V2COMP(P->loc));
00103         delete P; //FREE MEMORY
00104         P = tempPrev;
00105       }
00106     }
00107     if(debug) printf("accepting convex point %f,%f\n",V2COMP(P->loc));
00108     P = P->next;
00109   }while(P != firstPoint);
00110   
00111 }
00112 
00113 bool GrahamsScan::isConvexPoint(GrahamsScan::point* P)
00114 {
00115   return (P->loc - P->prev->loc).cross(P->next->loc - P->loc) > 0.0;
00116 }
00117 
00118 double GrahamsScan::findAngle(vector2f& loc1, vector2f& loc2)
00119 {
00120   //This function doesn't really return the true angle, it just returns a value x between -2 to 2 such that 
00121   // there is a one to one mapping between true angle and x, with x(0)=0, x(pi/2)=1, x(pi-eps)=2, 
00122   // x(-pi/2)=-1, and x(-pi+eps)=-2
00123   // This works for Graham's algorithm since the true angle isn't important, only the ordering of angles is.
00124   
00125   vector2f delta = loc2-loc1;
00126   
00127   double d = delta.length();
00128   if(fabs(delta.x)<DBL_MIN){
00129     if(delta.y>0.0)
00130       return 1.0;
00131     else
00132       return -1.0;
00133   }else if(delta.x>0.0){
00134     return delta.y/d;
00135   }else{ //delta.x<0.0
00136     if(delta.y>0.0)
00137       return 1.0 - delta.x/d;
00138     else
00139       return -1.0 + delta.x/d;
00140   }
00141 }
00142 
00143 void GrahamsScan::addPoint(point& Point)
00144 {
00145   static const bool debug = false;
00146   point *tempPoint,*tempPointA,*tempPointB, *curPoint;
00147   
00148   //ALLOCATE A NEW POINT STRUCTURE AND INITIALIZE INTERNAL VARIABLES
00149   tempPoint = new point;
00150   tempPoint->loc = Point.loc;
00151   tempPoint->angle=Point.angle;  
00152   tempPoint->next=NULL;
00153   tempPoint->prev=NULL;
00154   
00155   //TEST IF LIST IS EMPTY
00156   if (firstPoint==NULL){
00157     firstPoint=tempPoint;
00158     return;
00159   }
00160   
00161   //TEST IF ONLY ONE NODE IN LIST AND CURRENT NODE HAS GREATER ANGLE
00162   if (firstPoint->next==NULL && tempPoint->angle >= firstPoint->angle){
00163     firstPoint->next=tempPoint;
00164     tempPoint->prev=firstPoint;
00165     return;
00166   }
00167   
00168   curPoint=firstPoint;
00169   
00170   //CONTINUE THROUGH LIST UNTIL A NODE IS FOUND WITH A GREATER ANGLE THAN CURRENT NODE
00171   while ((tempPoint->angle > curPoint->angle || (tempPoint->angle + Epsilon > curPoint->angle && tempPoint->loc.y > curPoint->loc.y) )&& curPoint->next!=NULL)
00172     curPoint=curPoint->next;
00173   
00174   //Check if the point is a duplicate
00175   if(curPoint->prev != NULL){
00176     if(curPoint->prev->loc==tempPoint->loc)
00177       return;
00178   }
00179   
00180   //TEST IF NODE IS FIRSTPOINT.  IF SO, ADD AT FRONT OF LIST.
00181   if (curPoint==firstPoint){
00182     if(debug) printf("Adding %f,%f at the front\n",V2COMP(tempPoint->loc));
00183     firstPoint->prev=tempPoint;
00184     tempPoint->next=firstPoint;
00185     firstPoint=tempPoint;
00186     return;
00187   }else if(curPoint->next==NULL && tempPoint->angle >= curPoint->angle){
00188     //TEST IF WHILE LOOP REACHED FINAL NODE IN LIST.  IF SO, ADD AT END OF THE LIST.
00189     if(debug) printf("Adding %f,%f at the end\n",V2COMP(tempPoint->loc));
00190     curPoint->next=tempPoint;
00191     tempPoint->prev=curPoint;
00192     return;
00193   }else{ //OTHERWISE, INTERMEDIATE NODE HAS BEEN FOUND.  INSERT INTO LIST.  
00194     tempPointA=curPoint->prev;
00195     tempPointB=curPoint->prev->next;
00196     if(debug) printf("Adding %f,%f after %f,%f\n",V2COMP(tempPoint->loc),V2COMP(tempPointA->loc));
00197     tempPoint->next=tempPointB;
00198     tempPoint->prev=tempPointA;
00199     tempPoint->prev->next=tempPoint;
00200     tempPoint->next->prev=tempPoint;
00201   }
00202   
00203   return;   
00204 }
00205 
00206 
00207 void GrahamsScan::deleteAllPoints()
00208 {
00209   point *curPtr = firstPoint;
00210   point *nextPtr = curPtr->next;
00211   
00212   while(curPtr != NULL){
00213     nextPtr = curPtr->next;
00214     delete curPtr;
00215     curPtr = nextPtr;
00216     if(curPtr==firstPoint)
00217       break;
00218   }
00219   firstPoint = NULL;
00220   mzero<GrahamsScan>(*this);
00221 }
